title: Ticket #598: condor_submit's debug based on TOOL_DEBUG not SUBMIT_DEBUG
description:
The manual and man condor_submit say this... 

-debug
    Cause debugging information to be sent to stderr, based on the value of the configuration variable SUBMIT_DEBUG.

But the code says this... 

} else if ( match_prefix( ptr[0], "-debug" ) ) {
	// dprintf to console
	Termlog = 1;
	dprintf_config( "TOOL" );

One of the two must change.

They've never agreed, with the code being TOOL since 2001 and the manual being SUBMIT since 2005. Code wins?

                if( ptr[0][0] == '-' ) {
                        switch( ptr[0][1] ) {
-                       case 'g':
-                               // dprintf to console
-                               Termlog = 1;
-                               dprintf_config ("SUBMIT", 2 );
-                               break;
                        case 'v':

-                               DisableFileChecks = 1;

                                break;
                        case 'r':
